lead_paragraph: TUGGLE--Robert. The Metropolitan Opera mourns the death of its Director of Archives, Robert Tuggle, an invaluable member of the company whose passion for opera defined his life. He served as Director of Archives for more than 34 years, overseeing its many activities including the Archives Database, an exhaustive online compendium with detailed information on every performance in the company's 133-year history. Before coming to the Met, he worked in the education department of the Metropolitan Opera Guild for decades, beginning in 1957 when he was 24 years old. He was the author of The Golden Age of Opera and, at the time of his death, was at work on a biography of soprano Kirsten Flagstad. We extend our sincerest condolences to all those who knew and admired Bob, and whose lives were touched by his work. Peter Gelb, General Manager James Levine, Music Director 1/3
